alert.note: Alert for Grant (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 11:04PM CST until December 14 at 12:45AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Louisiana and northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, in north central Louisiana, Grant and Winn. In northwest Louisiana, Natchitoches and Sabine. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1103 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Natchitoches, Winnfield, Colfax, Montgomery, Florien, Natchez, Atlanta, Melrose, Cypress, Cloutierville, Bermuda, Bellwood, Flora, Chopin, Gorum, St. Maurice, Aloha, Kisatchie, Lake Iatt and Mount Carmel.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
